events.name: Western Allies Reject Ukraine's Request for Fighter Jets
events.wd_label: Western Allies Reject Ukraine's Request for Fighter Jets
events.wd_description: After agreeing to send tanks to Ukraine, the US and UK declined Ukraine's request for Western fighter jets, including F-16s, deeming the request impractical and signaling a limit to military support.
events.description: After agreeing to send tanks to Ukraine, the US and UK declined Ukraine's request for Western fighter jets, including F-16s, deeming the request impractical and signaling a limit to military support.

events.name: Rejection of Fighter Jets Request
events.wd_description: The US and UK rejected Ukraine's request for F-16 fighter jets and other Western aircraft, citing practical concerns and signaling a limit to their military support.
events.description: The US and UK rejected Ukraine's request for F-16 fighter jets and other Western aircraft, citing practical concerns and signaling a limit to their military support.

events.name: US and UK Responses
events.wd_description: US President Joe Biden and a spokesperson from Downing Street both confirmed that sending fighter jets to Ukraine was not feasible, with Biden stating "no" to the request for F-16s.
events.description: US President Joe Biden and a spokesperson from Downing Street both confirmed that sending fighter jets to Ukraine was not feasible, with Biden stating "no" to the request for F-16s.

events.name: Ukraine's Request for Fighter Jets
events.wd_description: Following the agreement by the US and Germany to send tanks, Ukraine requested 200 fighter jets, including F-16s, to enhance its defense capabilities against Russia.
events.description: Following the agreement by the US and Germany to send tanks, Ukraine requested 200 fighter jets, including F-16s, to enhance its defense capabilities against Russia.

events.name: Honduras Moves to Establish Official Relations with China
events.wd_label: Honduras Moves to Establish Official Relations with China
events.wd_description: Honduran President Xiomara Castro announced her decision to establish official relations with China, effectively ending the country's diplomatic ties with Taiwan, reducing Taiwan's allies to 13.
events.description: Honduran President Xiomara Castro announced her decision to establish official relations with China, effectively ending the country's diplomatic ties with Taiwan, reducing Taiwan's allies to 13.

events.name: Honduras' Decision
events.wd_description: Honduran President Xiomara Castro instructed the foreign minister to establish official relations with China, which would lead to the end of the country's diplomatic ties with Taiwan.
events.description: Honduran President Xiomara Castro instructed the foreign minister to establish official relations with China, which would lead to the end of the country's diplomatic ties with Taiwan.

events.name: Taiwan's Response
events.wd_description: Taiwan's foreign ministry expressed serious concern over Honduras' decision and urged the country to reconsider its position, as the move would further isolate Taiwan diplomatically.
events.description: Taiwan's foreign ministry expressed serious concern over Honduras' decision and urged the country to reconsider its position, as the move would further isolate Taiwan diplomatically.

events.name: China's Response
events.wd_description: China's foreign ministry welcomed Honduras' decision and expressed willingness to develop friendly and cooperative relations with the country.
events.description: China's foreign ministry welcomed Honduras' decision and expressed willingness to develop friendly and cooperative relations with the country.

events.name: ICC Issues Arrest Warrant for Vladimir Putin and Maria Lvova-Belova
events.wd_label: ICC Issues Arrest Warrant for Vladimir Putin and Maria Lvova-Belova
events.wd_description: The International Criminal Court (ICC) issued arrest warrants for Russian President Vladimir Putin and Russian official Maria Lvova-Belova, accusing them of involvement in the deportation of Ukrainian children to Russia.
events.description: The International Criminal Court (ICC) issued arrest warrants for Russian President Vladimir Putin and Russian official Maria Lvova-Belova, accusing them of involvement in the deportation of Ukrainian children to Russia.

events.name: ICC Arrest Warrants
events.wd_description: The International Criminal Court issued arrest warrants for Vladimir Putin and Maria Lvova-Belova, alleging their involvement in a scheme to deport Ukrainian children to Russia.
events.description: The International Criminal Court issued arrest warrants for Vladimir Putin and Maria Lvova-Belova, alleging their involvement in a scheme to deport Ukrainian children to Russia.

events.name: Allegations of Child Deportation
events.wd_description: The ICC stated that it has sufficient evidence to believe that Putin and Lvova-Belova were involved in the deportation of Ukrainian children and that Putin failed to exercise control over subordinates who committed these acts.
events.description: The ICC stated that it has sufficient evidence to believe that Putin and Lvova-Belova were involved in the deportation of Ukrainian children and that Putin failed to exercise control over subordinates who committed these acts.

events.name: Ukraine's Response
events.wd_description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky expressed appreciation for the ICC's decision and noted that Ukrainian investigations suggest direct Kremlin involvement in the forced deportation of children.
events.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky expressed appreciation for the ICC's decision and noted that Ukrainian investigations suggest direct Kremlin involvement in the forced deportation of children.

events.name: US Battery Supply Chain Investment Since 2021
events.wd_label: US Battery Supply Chain Investment Since 2021
events.wd_description: Since President Joe Biden took office in January 2021, a total of US$92 billion has been invested in the US battery supply chain, including government and private sector investments in recycling, materials separation and processing, and component manufacturing.
events.description: Since President Joe Biden took office in January 2021, a total of US$92 billion has been invested in the US battery supply chain, including government and private sector investments in recycling, materials separation and processing, and component manufacturing.

events.name: Investment Overview
events.wd_description: A total of US$92 billion has been invested in the US battery supply chain since January 2021, with 78 facilities announced, including recycling, materials separation and processing, and component manufacturing projects.
events.description: A total of US$92 billion has been invested in the US battery supply chain since January 2021, with 78 facilities announced, including recycling, materials separation and processing, and component manufacturing projects.

events.name: Specific Projects
events.wd_description: Recent projects include Israel-based ICL’s US$400 million LFP cathode material plant in St. Louis, Missouri, and the Rhyolite Ridge lithium project in Esmerelda County, Nevada, supported by a US$700 million DOE loan.
events.description: Recent projects include Israel-based ICL’s US$400 million LFP cathode material plant in St. Louis, Missouri, and the Rhyolite Ridge lithium project in Esmerelda County, Nevada, supported by a US$700 million DOE loan.

events.name: t: ICL LFP Cathode Material Plant
events.wd_label: t: ICL LFP Cathode Material Plant
events.wd_description: ICL’s US$400 million LFP cathode material plant in St. Louis, Missouri, will be half-funded by a federal grant through the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law’s US$2.8 billion funding for battery projects.
events.description: ICL’s US$400 million LFP cathode material plant in St. Louis, Missouri, will be half-funded by a federal grant through the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law’s US$2.8 billion funding for battery projects.

events.name: t: Rhyolite Ridge Lithium Project
events.wd_description: The DOE’s Loan Programs Office announced a conditional commitment to provide a US$700 million loan for the Rhyolite Ridge lithium project in Esmerelda County, Nevada, which will process lithium carbonate for around 370,000 EVs per year.
events.description: The DOE’s Loan Programs Office announced a conditional commitment to provide a US$700 million loan for the Rhyolite Ridge lithium project in Esmerelda County, Nevada, which will process lithium carbonate for around 370,000 EVs per year.

events.name: Legislative Impact
events.wd_description: The Inflation Reduction Act and Bipartisan Infrastructure Law have significantly improved the investment climate for the US battery supply chain, increasing the DOE Loan Programs Office's loan authority from US$60 billion to US$100 billion.
events.description: The Inflation Reduction Act and Bipartisan Infrastructure Law have significantly improved the investment climate for the US battery supply chain, increasing the DOE Loan Programs Office's loan authority from US$60 billion to US$100 billion.

events.name: Industry Trends
events.wd_description: The US’ planned lithium-ion gigafactory capacity is growing twice as fast as Europe’s, driven by the incentives and support provided by recent legislation, prompting Europe to consider its own support measures to retain investment.
events.description: The US’ planned lithium-ion gigafactory capacity is growing twice as fast as Europe’s, driven by the incentives and support provided by recent legislation, prompting Europe to consider its own support measures to retain investment.
